docs.lead_paragraph: Freud got it the wrong way around, some psychiatrists are now asserting. Emotional disorders do not cause people to think in the bizarre, illogical patterns typical of mental illness. Rather, it is illogical or otherwise defective thinking patterns that cause emotional or behavioral problems.

headline.main: Emotional Disorders and Mental Illness: Psychiatrists Debate Cause-Effect Relationship

docs.lead_paragraph: Even keeping in mind the ancient Greek admonition against judging any man happy until he is dead, it would seem safe to say that the long odyssey of Joseph H. Cort has ended without bitterness and with the possibility, at least, of scientific accolade and wealth.
